channel.title: Banks on Rob Barry
channel.description: Recent content in Banks on Rob Barry

item.title: The Unintended Consequence of Closing High-Risk Accounts
item.description: The Government Accountability Office has launched an inquiry into the effects of banks’ increasing efforts to close high-risk accounts, including those held by money-transfer firms and humanitarian organizations. Read the full story here.

item.title: Cautious Banks Hinder Charity Financing
item.description: Account shutdowns and holdups of money transfers hinder ability to deliver aid to refugees. Read the full story here.

item.title: Losing Count: U.S. Terror Rules Drive Money Underground
item.description: Banks close the accounts of customers they fear may be up to no good, evicting from the financial system those the government most wants to watch. Read the full story here.

item.title: Ax Falls at Smaller Banks
item.description: Smaller U.S. banks and savings institutions are cutting jobs in a sign of a deepening financial-industry retrenchment that is shaking firms from Main Street to Wall Street. Read the full story here.
